metadata.title: CVE-2024-47668 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:lib/generic-radix-tree.c: Fix rare race in __genradix_ptr_alloc()If we need to increase the tree depth, allocate a new node, and thenrace with another thread that increased the tree depth before us, we'llstill have a preallocated node that might be used later.If we then use that node for a new non-root node, it'll still have apointer to the old root instead of being zeroed - fix this by zeroing itin the cmpxchg failure path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-47668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic-64k - 6.11.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-aws - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1003-azure - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1001-gcp - 6.11.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.11.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle - 6.11.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle-64k - 6.11.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.11.0-1003-raspi - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required
